title.narrative: Lutte anti-mines humanitaire pour réduire les risques des accidents et préserver la vie dans les communautés impactées par la contamination explosive au Burkina Faso

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to provide life-saving anti-mine action protection assistance to internally displaced people and host communities in Oudalan and Yagha (Sahel region), Gourma and Tapoua (Est region), and Sanmatenga and Namentenga (Centre-Nord region). UNOPS, in partnership with the UN Mine Action Service (UNMAS), aims to reduce the risk of injury from mines and unexploded ordnance by raising awareness and promoting behavioural change through public-information campaigns and mine risk education sessions. The project provides life-saving assistance to 105,000 people, including 29,500 women, 19,000 men, 56,500 children, and 1,500 persons with disabilities.
